overview.headline: Book your greatest fake vacation!
overview.text: This demo site is a booking site like Airbnb which contains login, search, and reservation functionality utilizing mongoDB on the back end to keep track of property availability and reservations.  This site is my first foray into server-side development and conforms to REST API principles.  This project was a hands-on playground for much my learning journey, and inspired many of the other projects in my portfolio.
bullets: Search for available properties using geocode lookup and other attributes
Login to view and make reservations
Sortable search results with pagination

overview.headline: Thank you for visiting!
overview.text: I’m very grateful for your time and consideration.  Web development has been an aspiration for my entire professional life, and I am eager to start the next step in this journey.  I have worked on many projects as part of a team, but these are some of the only truly solo projects, making them even more meaningful. This site was built with React and Next.js to take advantage of performance optimizations by its static site generation approach and ease of hosting. I look forward to discussing how we can continue the journey, solving problems the entire way!
bullets: Responsive design custom built with care
Interactive project list
Spring-based animations

overview.headline: Responsive properties for React!
overview.text: Taking on static site generation (SSG) and server side rendering (SSR) in my first react project immediately introduced new challenges and concepts.  I developed the prop-x library to take better advantage of static site generation by doing more work in the static site generation process.  This means the logic is run when the site is built and deployed rather than when the user visits the web page.  Prop-x does this by providing an API to pass JavaScript properties into the styled-components CSS using responsive media queries.
bullets: Responsive properties in React components
Retrieve property values in styled-components based on breakpoints
Useful functions for transforming properties and applying additional logic

overview.headline: Responsive themes for reusable components!
overview.text: Coming from the world of business and consulting where reusability was the key to efficiently deliver with consistency, and knowing reusability is a core concept of programming, I was a little surprised that reusable component frameworks and related libraries weren’t well.... a little more reusable and efficiently used. Simply styling a third party component can become an onerous task in reverse engineering. This was the inspiration for this library. Perhaps there is a path forward with Themeweaver and “headless” component systems like Radix UI.
bullets: Responsive theme styles using semantic names
Theme by variants and states
Project configured with jest testing framework & GitHub actions

overview.headline: Customizable grid of pictures!
overview.text: This is a reusable picture tile component and was built as an experimentation of the prop-x library. It is a breeze to configure for different screen sizes and to change dimensions.  It uses loading spinners and blurring to gracefully load images.
